page.title: 09Whittlesford School Log Book
page.content: This is kept by the Headmaster to record the day to day events in the life of the school.Entries in the{1985 {Summer Term,}which began on{15th {April,}included this selection:{April {22nd:}Over 200 people attended a meeting in the hall to hear about the development of the{A505 Road. {May1st:}Children from{Thriplow {and Whittlesford Schools}presented "A Victorian Scrapbook"of music, speech and drama,to an audience of parents and friends.{2nd}Children played parents teams at netball and football. {16th}The school went to{St. Mary and {St. Andrew's}church for an Ascension Day Service, taken by the Priest - in - Charge.{22nd}Class 3 visited{Wimpole {Hall Home Farm,}near Royston. June {10th}The Head of Mathematics, of {Sawston Village College,}spent the morning in school.
